sub_title: Freelance science editor, educator & translator specialising in editing non-native English
summary:
I help scientists and academics in the Netherlands achieve publishable papers. I don't just "correct the English": I edit to improve the clarity, logic and scientific integrity of the text. Where necessary, I use comments to explain and instruct.
- My editing is underpinned by experience as an in-house editor and my own research on writing and editing non-native English.
I am a founder member and past chair of SENSE (Society of English-language professionals in the Netherlands).
- I have particular affinity for environmental and earth sciences, and for the tropics: my first two degrees were in geography and I have fieldwork experience in Guyana and Sabah (Malaysia).
* I translate Dutch to English, primarily for scientists and academics. 
* I devise and give WORKSHOPS ON EDITING NON-NATIVE ENGLISH to translation students and language professionals. So far, the workshops have been given in the Netherlands, the UK, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Croatia and Luxembourg.  At the most recent edition (in Girona) there were 12 languages (excluding English) represented! 
* I give incidental lectures and classes to Master's and PhD students on writing academic/scientific English and editing.
* I give customised workshops on presentation skills for scientists.
* I give popular illustrated talks on Dutch English.
